channel.title: All Mighty House Sounds By DJ Henry Hall
channel.description:
DJ Henry Hall is a New York City DJ. Henry plays a mixture of soulful and deep House Music layered with beautiful vocals. He has spun at many clubs across the country. As a result of overwhelming demand, Henry produces a monthly podcast here at http://www.djhenryhall.podomatic.com - Here you can also find, complete track listing and subscribe with you favorite RSS reader or podcatcher.
For booking arrangements: djhenryhall@yahoo.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: NYC Deep House layered with soulful vocals! Love to hear your feed back at djhenryhall@yahoo.com
channel.itunes:author: Henry Hall

item.title: BY MY DESIGN
item.description: Once again, here is a new installment of tasty tunes. This session you will find fantastic productions and remixes from the likes of Timmy Regisford, Arnold Jarvis, Lem, Director’s Cut featuring Frankie Knuckles and Eric Kupper. You’ll also discover a slammin’ remix from Jimpster which Tanya from http://soulsauce.podomatic.com schooled me on. Check out her podcast when you have a moment – it’s great! Enjoy! As always, feel free to let me know your thoughts on my Facebook fan page: http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=533010649#!/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453 1. item.title: Another Chance

item.title: Traveling - A Little Late
item.description: Hello friends, We are off to a new year and I have once again assembled an assortment of key jam’s. First, I want to highlight Josh Milan’s Honeycomb Music project (http://honeycombmusic.blogspot.com). Many might recognize Josh by his work as part of Blaze. Josh has put together a lovely compilation of artist. I have featured two on this podcast – Angela Johnson and Lamone. I’m sure you all will enjoy. In addition, you will be delighted by the likes of Donae’o, Andrea Love, Meshell Ndegeocello, and massive vocal/remix from Shaun Escoffery & Kenny Carpenter. Plus, you find an un-released Grant Nelson remix of Charisse Arrington’s “Down with this”. Enjoy! http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=533010649#!/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453 1. Miguel Migs Feat. Meshell Ndegeocello – Close Your Eyes (Osunlade’s Yoruba Soul Mix) (http://www.traxsource.com/index.php?act=show&fc=tpage&cr=titles&cv=118102) 2. Manoo & Francois A. Feat. Dyanna Fearon – Crying For Love (Vocal Mix) (http://www.traxsource.com/index.php?act=show&fc=tpage&cr=titles&cv=128741) 3. item.title: WINNING AND LOSING!
item.description: Hello friends, I’m back again with another installment of tasty tunes. In this episode, I have thrown in quite a few essential classics from the likes of 4th Measure Men (MK) and Groove Committee (a Victor Simonelli dance floor hit). Also, several new and just stellar songs from Pat Bedeau & Steve Gurley (Affection), D-Reflection and Knee Deep. Enjoy! You can keep up with me on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=533010649#!/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453 1. Koyla Feat. Amalia – Angels Calling (Original) (http://www.traxsource.com/index.php?act=show&fc=tpage&cr=titles&cv=76339) 2. item.dc:creator: Henry Hall
item.itunes:summary:
Hello friends,
I’m back again with another installment of tasty tunes. In this episode, I have thrown in quite a few essential classics from the likes of 4th Measure Men (MK) and Groove Committee (a Victor Simonelli dance floor hit). Also, several new and just stellar songs from Pat Bedeau & Steve Gurley (Affection), D-Reflection and Knee Deep.
Enjoy!
You can keep up with me on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=533010649#!/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453

item.title: THIS IS HOW I FEEL!
item.description: This month, I sorted through my record library and plucked out a few gems from the likes of Joi Cardwell, Roland Clark, Ananda Project and Judy Albanese. You will also find a few exceptional remixes from Richard Earnshaw, Eric Kupper, Frankie Knuckles, Joey Negro, and Sean McCabe. As always, feel free to let me know what you think on my Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453 1. item.title: I'm Not Afraid of the Phuture!
item.description: Hello friends, Here’s my final mix of 2010. This mix was originally broad-casted on back2backfm.com. But first, I want to thank everyone who downloaded and stream my podshows. Secondly, I want to give a big shout out to everyone who has shared my mixes with their friends. And lastly, I hope everyone has a brilliant holiday. Getting to the music – I started by pulled out a fantastic mix of Robin Thick “Magic”. Later, I drop into a massive track from Adam Rois & Ruben Toro – Basil’s instrumental is simply dynamite. Also, I dropped some classic gems from Kerri Chandler, Quentin Harris, Boyd Jarvis and Michael Watford. Also, I’ve dropped The Sunburst Band’s ‘Rough Times’ again. This is a fantastic song and I just can’t get enough of the dub’s and full vocal mixes. It’s essential to mention that this song was writing by the “LEGENDARY” writing team – ASHFORD AND SIMPSON (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ashford_%26_Simpson) ...Enough said! Enjoy! http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=533010649#!/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453 1. Robin Thicke – Magic (Movement Soul Mix) (http://www.robinthicke.com) 2. item.title: THIS IS MY VIBE: HOUSE MUSIC!
item.description: This month, I commenced this session with a powerful gospel inspired song from the legendary Jocelyn Brown entitled ‘Worthy’. Later, I progress into brilliant tracks and songs from Dennis Ferrer, Rosie Gains, Kenny Bobien, Manny Ward & Joi Cardwell. You’ll also be excited to hear to monster classic’s from Jody Albanese, Darryl James, David Anthony and Mousse T. Please sit back and enjoy the vibe for the next one hundred and twenty minutes. item.title: Choice Vocals & Heavy Bass... House Music Just How I Like It!
item.description: In this session, I begin with an underground classic from Chicago’s legendary Shay Jones & Ten City’s Byron Burke. Then I progress into a future classic from Richard Earnshaw, entitled ‘In Time’. You’ll pleasantly hear Roy Ayers in the background and commanding the vibes. The Godfather of House, Frankie Knuckles said ‘this will become apart of my permanent repertoire” and you better believe it! Later I progress into serious jams from Joey Negro, Timmy Regisford, Quentin Harris and Boyd Jarvis. Also, you find a good amount of vocal gems from the beloved Peven Everett, Michelle Weeks, First Choice and the lovely Kim English. As always, let me know what you think at djhenryhall@yahoo.com and feel free to share with your friends - http://www.djhenryhall.podomatic.com and/or join my spot on facebook at http://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453 1. item.title: Feeling This Groove!
item.description: For the next one hundred and twenty minutes I present my current favorites! I begin this session with the legendary Roy Ayers then later break into an amazing track from King Brit entitled ‘Try Love”. Shortly after, I pulled out a future classic from Dennis Ferrer and Sound Factory Bar/Frankie Knuckles classic featuring Andrea Mendez. You’ll also hear songs and tracks from my friend Willy Washington, Grant Nelson and Louie Vega. As always, feel free to let me know what you think at my Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453 1. item.dc:creator: Henry Hall
item.itunes:summary:
For the next one hundred and twenty minutes I present my current favorites! I begin this session with the legendary Roy Ayers then later break into an amazing track from King Brit entitled ‘Try Love”. Shortly after, I pulled out a future classic from Dennis Ferrer and Sound Factory Bar/Frankie Knuckles classic featuring Andrea Mendez. You’ll also hear songs and tracks from my friend Willy Washington, Grant Nelson and Louie Vega.
As always, feel free to let me know what you think at my Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453

item.title: Luv 2 Love House
item.description: For the next one hundred and twenty minutes I present to you brilliant House Music. In this installation you will find fantastic songs from Kenny Bobien, Andrea Love, Dawn Tallman, and Robert Owens. In addition, I dropped a Shelter Classic from Keisha Jenkins, a Def Mix classic remix of Simply Red and an great song from Ann Nesby produced the mid 90’s. As always, feel free to let me know what you think at my Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/pages/DJ-HENRY-HALL/334939421453 1. item.title: Put Some House in Your Heart (Diggin’ da crates series)

In this auspicious episode, you will cheerfully find pure gems from Frankie Knuckles, Satoshi Tomiie, Robert Owens, Janet Jackson, Quentin Harris, Blaze, Seal, Simply Red, Juliet Roberts, Romanthony. item.title: AND THIS IS MY HOUSE MUSIC!

item.title: House Music Gems
item.description: In this episode, I have carefully selected a few choice gems that will just delight your sensory organs. We begin with a Mood II Swing classic featuring the talented vocal execution by Mr. Lee Smith and then we later jump into another Mood II Swing song featuring song writer and my friend Willy Washington. After, I quickly progress into several dynamic vocals from Arnold Jarvis, Ceybil Jefferies, Lynette Smith, Pedro Herrera and the legendary Whitney Houston. You will also find a special track called ‘Thoughts of You’. This is a song I wrote and produced with Paul Russaw 15 years ago… Dam I’m getting old. It’s one of my first issued productions, so it holds a special place in my heart. Thankfully, Lilla from Kult Record recently re-released the single on itunes and Beatport. I finish the set with naughty & dirty Mood II Swing classic track originally on Eightball Records entitled ‘Penetration’. As always, feel free to let me know what you think at djhenryhall@yahoo.com or visit my podshow page http://www.djhenryhall.podomatic.com 1. Mood II Swing – I Need Your Luv (Right Now) (Lem’s Church Mix) (https://www.beatport.com/en-US/html/content/home/detail/1/beatport#app=2a02&a486-index=3) 2. DJ Le Roi Featuring Chappell – Get Ready (Halo City Deep Vocal Dub Mix) (http://www.mn2s.com) (http://www.myspace.com/halocitydeep) 8. Kerri Chandler Featuring Treasa Diva Fennie – Heal My Heart (Kerri Chandler Big Mix) (http://www.kingstreetsounds.com) 9. Danism & Michael Watford – Change – MN2S (http://www.mn2s.com) 10. item.title: Tasty House Music
item.description: Hello! Here’s my latest installment of tasty tunes! Let’s jump right into it – I start with a Chez Damier & Ron Trent's dubby piano track classic entitled “Foot Therapy”. Later I run through a few brilliant full vocal songs from Jill Scott, Darryl D’Bonneau, Jose Carretas featuring Dani, Kathy Brown, Frankie Knuckles & Nicki Richards, and Vernessa Mitchell. item.title: Danger: House Music
item.description: Once again, I bring forth superb house music that currently moves me to better and brighter places. In this session, I try to keep a laid back and relaxed vibe (for the most part). You will experience some old school disco-funk flavors that have been updated to fit today’s sound. I begin the set with Knee Deep featuring Cathy Battistess, “All About Love” – this is simply a brilliant vocal. Later on in the set, I had to run the Lovebirds Suite Instrumental. I’m sure everyone will enjoy. Other highlights: I didn’t realize when I was mixing but I have featured a lot of tracks either produced or remixed by Knee Deep. Then there is the Motooo Project, “Give Me Love” – I’ve been trying to include this into a show for a while and here it is! Later, you'll find material from Jeremy Sylvester, who has a killer tracked titled “So Addicted” – Major! I finish up with some classics – Jaydee’s “Plastic Dreams” – I always enjoy David Morales remixes. Then I progress into Kim English’s “Nite Life” – This record just sums up my life. As always, let me know what you think at djhenryhall@yahoo.com and feel free to share with your friends - http://www.djhenryhall.podomatic.com 1. Knee Deep Feat. Cathy Battistessa – All About Love (Knee Deep Vocal Mix) (www.kneedeep.de) 2. Lem – Red Light District (http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/lemsounds) 3. The Freddy Turner Project Feat. item.title: Deep Vocal's and House Track's
item.description: Once again, I present to you a monthly dose of House Music. Just wanted to highlight a few jams: I opened the set with “Escape into U” written and produced by my friend Lem & vocal performance by my high school pal Chandler Pennyfeather. Later, I progressed into two mixes by Jon Culter – “Vision” and “Escape” - Absolutely Brilliant. In between those jams I feature another song by Lem featuring Mario Vasquez “Again” – I JUST LOVE this song!!! Track listings are located at http://www.djhenryhall.podomatic.com Feel free to leave comments here or on myspace: http://www.myspace.com/djhenryhallofficial And if you like my mixes – please forward my links to your friends! 1. Lem Featuring Chandler Pennyfeather – Escape Into U (http://www.myspace.com/urbanloungemusic) 2. JCS Featuring Patsy Fuller – Undecided (Soul Deep Vocal Mix) (http://www.facebook.com/home.php#/group.php?gid=100567989080&ref=ts) 3. Nature Love – Vision (Jon Cutler Distant Music Mix) (http://www.distantusa.com) 4. Blacke Reary – Step It Up (Richard Earnshaw Mix) (http://www.hermosarecordings.com) * * * * D I V A'S * * * * 5. Souldynamic Featuring Susu Bobien – 99 & Half (Souldynamic Club Mix) (http://www.purplemusic.ch) 6. DJ Neo and Jocelyn Brown – Better Life (Perceptions #1 By Nick and Danny Chatelain) (http://www.vendetta-music.com) 7. Sire & DJ Aphreme – Tell Me (http://www.myspace.com/djaphreme) 10. Lem Featuring Mario Vasquez – Again (http://www.myspace.com/urbanloungemusic) ** Exclusive** 11. Angel-A – Escape (Jon Cutler’s Distant Music Mix) (http://www.myspace.com/djeman) (http://www.distantusa.com) 12. Groove Assasin – Trinidad (Main Mix) (http://www.kingstreetsounds.com) 13. Kenny Larakin & Shlomi Aber – Sketches EP (Shlomi Aber Version) (http://www.beasoneimprint.com) (http://www.myspace.com/shlomiaber) 14. Milton Jackson – 1998 (Shur I Kan Remix) (http://www.tronicsole.co.uk) 15. item.title: Piano House, Deep House, Vocal House – It’s Just House Music
item.description: This month I bring to you a wide variety of exceptional vocals layered with a few brilliant tracks. As usual, track listings are below. However I wanted to highlight some of my favorites: Joey Negro’s remix of Quentin Harris’s version of "Can’t Stop" is just fantastic. Timmy Regisford’s mix of Angie Stone’s "No Kidding" is excellent and I’ve been trying to get it into the podshow for a while now! Yeah! And I, had, had, had to break out some vinyl (rather dust off. LOL!) - JTQ is one of my favorite records. John Robinson used to play this record near everyday over one of my long lost teenage summer's on WBLS' mid-day mix - of course. When will NY radio embrace house music again? As always, let me know what you think at djhenryhall@yahoo.com or leave a message here at http://www.djhenryhall.podomatic.com 1. Kim Davis - Valentine 4 Life (Reel Soul Main Vocal) (http://www.homerecordings.ca & http://www.Myspace.com/homerecording) 2. Kim Davis - Valentine 4 Life (Guy Robin Instrumental Mix) (http://www.homerecordings.ca & http://www.Myspace.com/homerecording) 3. Kem – I’m In Love (Timmy Regisford & Scott Wozniak Mix) (http://clubshelternyc.com) 5. Teddy Douglas Featuring Margaret Grace - God Created Woman (http://www.basementboys.com) 6. Quentin Harris Featuring Jason Walker - Can't Stop (Joey Negro Mix) (http://www.strictly.com) 7. Seal – Violet (Shelter Mix) (http://clubshelternyc.com) 8. Roy Ayers - Brand New Feeling (Sting International Controversy Remixes) (http://www.bbemusic.com & http://www.royayers.com) 9. Angie Stone – No Kidding Vox (Scott Wozniak & Timmy Regisford Mix) (http://clubshelternyc.com) 10. Jazzy Jeff - House of Tribe (Jazzy Jeff’s Main Mix) (http://www.myspace.com/tsboxchicago) 11. Hanna Hais - Une Journee Avec Toi (Soul Dynamic & Fiorese Remix) (http://www.hannahais.com & http://www.atalmusic.com) 12. Gorge - Kassiande EP (Marc Romboy Remix) (http://freerangerecords.co.uk) 13. item.title: House Grooves! An Assortment of Soulful Vocal and Deep Tracks
item.description: Welcome to my latest journey through this thing we call House Music. For the next 120+ minutes, I will take your through some essential tracks. item.title: Bassline's and more (Classic Underground House Tracks)
item.description: In this episode I really had to dig through my record library. (and it was dusty!) Here are some of my favorite early house jams - DJ's like Frankie Knuckles, David Morales, Tony Humpfries, Timmy Regisford would just kill us on the dance floor. (In a good way of course!) 1. Bassline - ? 2. What is house - ? 3. Love on top of love - Grace Jones 4. Raw Basics - Raw Elements 5. The five tones - Pizarro 6. In the middle of the night - ? 7. Strobe light - Black Sheep 8. What you need - Soft House Company 9. Apt 1A - House'n Authority 10. Alright - Sterling Void 11. What you need - Soft House Company 12 Shake your body - Jeanette Thomas 13. Tito Puente beats 14. I'll be your friend - Robert Owens 15. French Kiss - Lil Louis 16. London Express 17. Let's go Let's go - Fast Eddie

item.title: Labor Day Special
item.description: So, most of my NYC (and 'burbs) peeps have asked me to not post the hard, progressive, NEW!, stuff I've been playing but they ask me to bring back some essential tracks to listen to during this Labor Day Weekend. Of course, I'm posting this after the holiday. However, I hope you all enjoy and remember... for those that can't remember... this is really NYC ground work for the world! 1. In the street (Disco) 2. Paradise (Disco) 3. Rooftop -Mariah Carey (David Morales Mix) 4. What is this thing call love - Alexander O'Neal (Def Mix) 5. I'm a womam 6. Ain't no running away - willy washington and paula 7. Step in to my love - Jovonn 8. Lil Louis - Lonely 9. Afrika, Afrika 10. You can't hide (Murk) 11. Get some lovin' (Murk) 12. Strobe Light - Black Sheep (Morales) 13. Get Out - Kerri Chandler 14. Stay togehter - B. Tucker
